items.title: Enhancing resource utilization and privacy in IoT data placement through fuzzy logic and PSO optimization
items.description: This research addresses the challenges of managing vast data generated by IoT devices in cloud environments, focusing on optimizing resource utilization, energy efficiency, and privacy. We propose a Fuzzy-Particle Swarm Optimization (PSO) framework that intelligently allocates IoT data to cloud resources by handling uncertainties in resource availability and privacy sensitivity. The framework significantly enhances resource efficacy, achieving 89% resource utilization, 98.5% privacy sensitivity, and reduces energy consumption to 0.7 kWh. This work demonstrates a holistic approach to efficient and secure IoT data management in cloud environments.

items.title: A BABY MONITORING SYSTEM, AND METHOD THEREOF
items.description: A utility patent of "A BABY MONITORING SYSTEM, AND METHOD THEREOF" is filed - 202441039415. This system utilizes cutting-edge technology to analyze and classify infant cries in real-time, aiding parents in better understanding and responding to their baby's needs. Key features include: analysis of five distinct types of cry signals: belly pain, burping, discomfort, hunger, and fatigue; use of SMOTE for dataset balancing and Mel Spectrogram for capturing cry patterns; implementation of a Convolutional Neural Network (CNN) for accurate cry classification; a user-friendly design featuring a WiFi module, memory card, microphone, night vision camera, microcontroller, and mobile app integration.
